questions.question_text:
An email marketing team is setting up a campaign to message customers who register for an event. The registration data is being gathered in another system and will be passed to Marketing Cloud daily, and updates made to the customers' registration information will be reflected in the same file.
How should the import of event registration data be configured?

discussion.content:
Import Wizard—This is a handy-dandy wizard located within the data extension. It allows you to manually bring your data into a data extension, and we discuss it in more detail later.
Import Activity—The Import Activity, like the Import Wizard, allows you to manually bring your data into a data extension. The main difference is the Import Activity can be automated using Automation Studio.

As per above definitions we can understand that correct option should be A. We need to overwrite to get rid of stale data.

choices.D: Use the Import Activity to add new records into the data extension.
choices.B: Use the Import Wizard to add new records into the data extension.
choices.A: Use the Import Activity to overwrite the records in the data extension.
choices.C: Use the Import Wizard to overwrite the records in the data extension.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants its emails to render uniquely between mobile and desktop devices. NTO would like the emails to be responsive.
Which two techniques could be used? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Use inline CSS styling on all HTML elements.
choices.C: Use a Basic, Empty, or Themed Template in Content Builder.
choices.A: Include @media query CSS in the email.

discussion.content:
A. Include @media query CSS in the email.
C. Use a Basic, Empty, or Themed Template in Content Builder.
Explanation:
Including @media query CSS in the email allows you to define different styles for different screen sizes, enabling responsive design. This means that the email will adapt its layout and formatting based on whether it is being viewed on a mobile or desktop device.

Using a Basic, Empty, or Themed Template in Content Builder provides a starting point for creating responsive emails. These templates are designed to automatically adjust their layout and styling to ensure optimal rendering across various devices and screen sizes.
